Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the likelihood of the New Orleans Saints going undefeated and winning the Super Bowl, stating that it has never been done before.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the prediction of the Saints going undefeated and winning the Super Bowl.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the fact that the 1972 Miami Dolphins had a perfect season and won the Super Bowl, providing an alternative explanation to the claim that it has never been done before.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the 1972 Miami Dolphins had a perfect season and won the Super Bowl.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the New Orleans Saints will continue their winning streak and overcome all challenges without considering potential obstacles or losses.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not acknowledging the possibility of the New Orleans Saints losing games or not making it to the Super Bowl.
Understate: None of the biases in the expert's verdict suggest an understatement bias.
